metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0272 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
GNOME NetworkManager allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(IPv6 traffic disruption) via a crafted MTU value in an IPv6 RouterAdvertisement (RA) message, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-8215.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-66-generic - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-66.108

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-66.108').
